verse.arabic_text: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَابْتَغُوا إِلَيْهِ الْوَسِيلَةَ وَجَاهِدُوا فِي سَبِيلِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verse.translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and seek the means [of nearness] to Him and strive in His cause that you may succeed.

theme_question.correct: Seeking nearness to Allah through Taqwa and righteous deeds
options: The specific rules of inheritance for orphans
Seeking nearness to Allah through Taqwa and righteous deeds

educational_notes.verse_context: This verse (5:35) is a pivotal command in Surah Al-Ma'idah, instructing the believers to combine internal God-consciousness (Taqwa) with active effort (striving) to draw closer to Allah. The 'Wasilah' mentioned refers to seeking means of approach through acts of obedience that please Him.
educational_notes.theme_explanation: Juz 6 covers the transition from the legal and social framework of Surah An-Nisa to the dietary laws, covenants, and inter-faith dialogue found in Surah Al-Ma'idah. A recurring theme is the importance of fulfilling contracts—both with people and with Allah.
educational_notes.surah_overview: Surah Al-Ma'idah is one of the final major Surahs revealed. It contains the verse declaring the completion of the religion (5:3). It focuses on the 'Halal' and 'Haram', the sanctity of life, and provides a detailed critique of the deviations of previous nations to serve as a guide for the Muslim Ummah.
